place.name: RUAN MAJOR
place.gazetteerText: RUAN-MAJOR, a parish in Helston district, Cornwall; near the coast, 7½ miles S S E of Helston, and 13 Sby W of Penryn r. station. Post-town, Ruan-Minor, under Helston, Cornwall. Acres, 2, 470. Real property, £932. Pop., 141. Houses, 25. The property is divided among a few. An ancient seat of the Eriseys was here. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Exeter. Value, £191. Patron, P. V. Robinson, Esq. The church istolerable. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
